cradle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves gently from side to side
cradle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She rocked the cradle to quieten the child.
cradle.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Like most Catholic children, he had heard stories of Ireland from the cradle.
cradle.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a structure that is used to lift something heavy up or down
cradle.translation[0].definitions[3].def: the part of a telephone where you put the receiver when you are not using it
cradle.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: She replaced the receiver on the cradle.
cradle.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to hold something gently, as if to protect it
cradle.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: John cradled the baby in his arms.
cradle.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to hold a telephone receiver by putting it between your ear and your shoulder
cradle.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: She hunched over the desk, telephone cradled at her neck.
